intro: Calonema echidnachilum, commonly known as the yellow calonema, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub with upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Calonema echidnachilum is prized in horticulture for its ornamental value and unique coloration.
